venue.name: Dogtown parking lot, near the rifle range

item.description:
Let's head up to Gloucester and Ipswitch to check out Dogtown to see the boulders with witty saying etched into them, and Apple picking at Russell Orchards.

The first stop will be dogtown around 11am, which is about a 1-2hr trail walk (a little ups and downs and rocks, nothing major), then we'll head up to Ipswitch for apple picking.  I've gone to both places on a walk Greg hosted a few years ago and it was a good walk, and Russell Orchards is pretty big, has a small petting zoo, and a store where you can buy cider, wine, cider donuts, ice cream, apples, other fruit, and all kinds of cool stuff.

 

Info about Dogtown: http://www.thedacrons.com/eric/dogtown

Russell Orchards: http://www.russellorchards.com/

 

Here's a map of how to get from Dogtown to Russell Orchards.  It's about a 20 minute drive.

For GPS's, you can put in 2 Dogtown Road, Gloucester, MA 01930 for Dogtown, and 143 Argilla Road, Ipswich, MA 01938 for Russell Orchards.

 

Please help out the urbanites and offer to carpool if you can.
item.how_to_find_us: My cell # is 617-968-8113 - call or text if you're late/lost, or email too. I'll be there with a green jacket and jeans.
item.name: Dogtown walk & Apple picking
